# Arpeggio: sus4 in F# (Shape: C)

## Brief Presentation
This arpeggio is a suspended 4th arpeggio in the key of F# major. It is played in the C shape on the guitar. The sus4 chord is characterized by the addition of a perfect 4th interval in place of the major 3rd found in a standard major chord, creating a sense of tension and resolution when played.

## Breakdown of Notes and Intervals
The notes in the F# sus4 arpeggio in the C shape are F# (root), B (4th), and C# (5th). The intervals in this arpeggio are Root, 4th, and 5th.

## Musical Genre and Flavor
Arpeggios, like the sus4 arpeggio in F#, are commonly used in various genres of music, including rock, pop, and jazz. The sus4 chord adds a touch of dissonance and color to chord progressions, creating a sense of anticipation and resolution. This particular arpeggio can add a dreamy and ethereal quality to music, making it suitable for introspective or reflective musical passages.

## Songs
Here are three songs that feature the sus4 arpeggio in F#:
1. **"Stairway to Heaven" by Led Zeppelin**: The iconic intro of this classic rock song features arpeggios with suspended chords, including the sus4 arpeggio in F#.
2. **"Don't Stop Believin'" by Journey**: This popular rock anthem includes arpeggios that incorporate suspended chords, showcasing the versatility of the sus4 arpeggio in F#.
3. **"Wonderwall" by Oasis**: This Britpop hit utilizes arpeggios with suspended chords, adding a melodic and harmonic interest with the sus4 arpeggio in F#.

These songs demonstrate how the sus4 arpeggio in F# can be used effectively in various musical contexts to create emotion and depth in compositions.
